contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox musical artist <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | name = DoCo | image = | caption = | image_size = <!-- Only for images narrower than 220 pixels --> | background = group_or_band | alias = | origin = | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]] | years_active = | label = | associated_acts = [[Two-Mix]] | website = | current_members = | past_members = [[Megumi Hayashibara]] (voice of female [[Ranma Saotome|Ranma]]),<br>[[Noriko Hidaka]] ([[Akane Tendo]]),<br>[[Minami Takayama]] ([[Nabiki Tendo]]), <br>[[Kikuko Inoue]] ([[Kasumi Tendo]]), <br>[[Rei Sakuma]] ([[Shampoo (Ranma ½)|Shampoo]]) }} '''DoCo''' is a [[Pop music|pop]] group composed of five female ''[[Ranma ½]]'' [[Voice acting in Japan|voice actresses]]. The performances are done in-character. DoCo has released three albums: ''DoCo★First'', ''DoCo☆Second'', and ''DoCo Original Karaoke''. Some of the songs were translated and performed in English by DoCo U.S.A., the corresponding English language voice actors. Some of their songs were used as the opening and ending themes for the ''Ranma ½'' [[List of Ranma %C2%BD episodes#OVA Episodes .281993-1996.29|OVA]], as well as in music videos that accompanied the OVAs. A few songs (such as the DoCo version of [[Coco (group)|CoCo]]'s "Equal Romance") also appear on various ''Ranma ½'' musical albums. ==Members== *[[Megumi Hayashibara]] (Japan) / [[Rose Hastreiter]] (USA), as female [[List of Ranma ½ characters#Ranma Saotome|Ranma]] *[[Noriko Hidaka]] (Japan) / [[Tanya Hancheroff]] (USA), as [[List of Ranma ½ characters#Akane Tendo|Akane Tendo]] *[[Minami Takayama]] (Japan) / [[Saffron Henderson]] (USA), as [[List of Ranma ½ characters#Nabiki Tendo|Nabiki Tendo]] *[[Kikuko Inoue]] (Japan) / [[Willow Johnson]] (USA), as [[List of Ranma ½ characters#Kasumi Tendo|Kasumi Tendo]] *[[Rei Sakuma]] (Japan) / [[Cathy Weseluck]] (USA), as [[List of Ranma ½ characters#Shampoo|Shampoo]] Before becoming a voice actress, Hidaka got her start in the 1980s as a [[tarento]] and pop singer. Takayama is one half of the [[Electronic music|electronic]] [[Pop music|pop]] duo [[Two-Mix]]. ==OVA appearance== DoCo makes one actual performance in the ''Ranma ½'' anime, in the OVA "Tendo Family Christmas Scramble" as the opening act for the Christmas party that is hosted by the Tendos. They perform a karaoke version of "Equal Romance" as the opening act for a talent show. ==Discography== '''DoCo★First''': * "Us From Now On" (僕たちはこれから ''Bokutachi wa Kore Kara'') * "Red Shoe Sunday" (赤い靴のSUNDAY ''Akai Kutsu no Sunday'') * "Liar" (うそつき ''Usotsuki'') * "A Slightly Hilly Road" (少しだけ坂道 ''Sukoshi Dake Sakamichi'') * "So Many Memories" (思い出がいっぱい ''Omoide ga Ippai'') * "Boyfriend" (彼 ''Kare'') '''DoCo☆Second''': * "A Pure and Honest Christmas" (清く正しいクリスマス ''Kiyoku Tadashii Kurisumasu'') * "In the Middle of Elementary School" (授業中の小学校 ''Jugyōchū no Shōgakkō'') * "Neverending Summer Vacation" (終わらない夏休み ''Owaranai Natsu Yasumi'') * "The Sparkling Sky & Your Voice" (かがやく空ときみの声 ''Kagayaku Sora to Kimi no Koe'') * "Love Vanished Once, Regrettably" (恋がひとつ消えてしまったの ''Koi ga Hitotsu Kiete Shimatta no'') * "Mutual Love is Complex (Live)" (フクザツな両想いLive Version ''Fukuzatsu na Ryōomoi Live Version'') ==External links== * ''[http://www.furinkan.com/ranma/music/musicians.html Ranma ½ musicians]'' at Rumic World * ''[http://www.usagi.org/~doi/seiyuu/groups/doco.html DoCo]'' at Seiyuu Database *[http://hp.ponycanyon.co.jp/pchp/cgi-bin/PCHPM.pl?TRGID=PCHP_SKH_1010&CMD=DSP&DSP_SKHBNG=199400010527&DSP_SKHKETSEQ=001 ポニーキャニオン - らんま1/2 DoCo★オリジナルカラオケ：らんま1/2 DoCo] {{ja icon}} *[http://hp.ponycanyon.co.jp/pchp/cgi-bin/PCHPM.pl?TRGID=PCHP_SKH_1010&CMD=DSP&DSP_SKHBNG=199400010290&DSP_SKHKETSEQ=001 ポニーキャニオン - らんま1/2 DoCo☆Second：らんま1/2 DoCo] {{ja icon}} {{Ranma navigation}} [[Category:Ranma ½]] [[Category:Japanese pop music groups]] [[Category:Japanese girl groups]] {{Japan-band-stub}} {{anime-music-stub}}
